teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Vegetarians and Vegans on Kiva
teams.loan_because: We have a vision of a healthier, more compassionate and sustainable world. Hard work is often not enough to escape poverty and we gladly welcome the opportunity to give people and their businesses a fighting chance. Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.name: Humanist
teams.loan_because: It takes people to help people.  We believe in good.
teams.description:
Humanists strive to live good and ethical lives, with no belief in the supernatural.  We give meaning and purpose to our lives through reason, compassion and action.

Most Atheists and non-religious people ARE Humanists, but don't realize it!

Our team helps the poor, builds the Humanist community and shows that non-religious people give, care and share.

We are endorsed by the American Humanist Association, British Humanist Association and International Humanist and Ethical Union.

teams.name: Women For Women International

teams.description: We lend especially to women entrepreneurs in countries where WFWI works to help women survivors of war rebuild their lives:  Afghanistan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Iraq, Nigeria, Rwanda, and Sudan.

teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

teams.name: Catholic Kiva
teams.loan_because: It is the right thing to do.
teams.description: Anyone is welcome to join our group.  The team is just for fun and to help build community.

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: Lynn Janoff
teams.loan_because:
Lynn was passionate about life and loved helping others. We want to honor her life and continue the work she began.
Lynn was never financially wealthy, but she had a heart of gold. She was a pillar of strength for her family, her many friends and her community. She was a strong, gutsy, outspoken woman with a lot of energy. When the cupboards at the local food pantry were bare she would organize a food drive. If she was watching the news on TV and saw a story about a stranger who needed money she would send a check.
She continued to impress and inspire her community with the grace through which she handled her battle with cancer. Even while undergoing exhausting medical treatments, she continued volunteering at her local housing organization, brought meals to a friend whoâ€™d had surgery, participated in a domestic violence fundraiser, played Santa for people unable to buy gifts for their children and signed up for Kiva, making her first loan of $100 to a woman for her retail store. 
She thought Kiva was a fantastic way to help people around the world. She cared deeply about empowering women and making sure they had enough to provide food and education for their children.
There were times in her life that Lynn struggled to pay her own bills, but she still gave because she knew the importance of helping others.

She is pictured with her great-granddaughter.
teams.description:
We are people who want Lynnâ€™s spirit of helping others to continue. She wanted to make the world a better place and we can still help her do that. 

Help us honor Lynn!!!
The team's goal is to get people who knew Lynn or are inspired by her story to sign up for Kiva and make their first $25 loan. If youâ€™re already a Kiva lender please join our team and make a new loan in her honor.

teams.name: Green Partnerships
teams.loan_because: We want to help create more sustainable and equitable communities all around the world.
teams.description:
We lend to individuals and groups engaged in businesses and services that help them earn a living but also help to protect the environment in their part of the world. We also strive to build green partnerships in our own communities by supporting the women and men who provide businesses, services, and products that benefit people and the Earth. 

Some of our team members mainly fund green loans, while others choose to designate a fraction of their loans to green enterprises. These are examples of just some of the loans Green Partnerships has helped to fund:

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: MoreWaggyTails,Less Barks&Growls
teams.whereabouts: Dog Lovers hearts (and cat lovers, too!)
teams.loan_because: We  wish humans would be more like our pet dogs. Warm, giving, loving unconditionally. And able to be independent and self-sufficient like our cats!
teams.description:
We want to show wags and encouragement more than growls. Want homes to be an oasis for returning workers. We want to lend instead of spending money on another chew toy or treat. Good workers deserve helping hands and good paws(pause). Dog owners, kitty companions, animal lovers, and pet friends are welcome! [Send the names of your pets - not just dogs - to post here:]
Our Fluff Buddies: Fella, Willie Wonka, Happy, Charlie, Bear, Polly, Lyla, Winnie, Georgio, Edie, Mei Mei, Bugsy, Shasta, Cody, Alma, Lukie,Duchess the BullDog, Latte and Lexi, Chai,  Georgia, Joy, Leila, Bosley, Emma, Page, Nigel, Gwendolyn, Spenser, Lena, Percy, Jasper, Riley, Philipe, Reno Sweeney, Madelaine, Sparkle and Pascal, Buba and Bella, Tmatira, and Iffy the wonder dog. 
Also doggie friendly cats: Fred the Cat, Spike, Missy (also known as Barfy), Tilly, Cherry, Jona, Paulette, Awaremi, Manx, Basheera, Spook and Spick, Pocket, Marty, Jubal, Dunster, Sua, Sadie, Mikie, Mary Chestnut, Friendly, much-loved Moose. 
(Take a look at our fun members' page!)

teams.name: Crazy Canucks
teams.loan_because: We live in a well-to-do nation and want to help those less fortunate than ourselves
teams.description: We are CANADIAN !!!

teams.name: women empowering women
teams.loan_because: empower a woman, change the world.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Kivans Against Cockfighting Loans
teams.loan_because: KACL believes in the power of microloans and the potential of Kiva, but we believe Kiva should not list loans related to Cockfighting (or Dog Fighting, Bull Fighting, or any other blood sports).
teams.description: We want to help people escape poverty, and avoid the promotion and celebration of extreme cruelty.

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: DoSomething
teams.loan_because: DoSomething.org is the countryâ€™s largest not-for-profit for young people and social change. We have 1,666,208 members (and counting) who kick ass on causes they care about. Bullying. Animal cruelty. Homelessness. Cancer. The list goes on. DoSomething.org spearheads national campaigns so 13- to 25-year-olds can make an impact - without ever needing money, an adult, or a car. Over 2.4 million people took action through DoSomething.org in 2012. Why? Because apathy sucks.

teams.name: Dermalogica
teams.loan_because:
NEWS! In honor of International Women's Day, if you join our team, then make a loan and credit our team, we'll match your loan with one of our own!!*

We believe in the multiplier effect of supplying capital to women - supporting a woman in opening or growing a business enables her to buy food and housing for her family, send her children to school, and contribute to the welfare of her community.  We want to help put more women on the road to Financial Independence Through Entrepreneurship. Join the FITE!
* We'll match up to 3,000 loans.
teams.description: Dermalogica is the number one line of skin care products for professional skin therapists and consumers worldwide.

teams.name: Firefighters of South Carolina
teams.loan_because: We have a heart and we care enough to share!
teams.description: Our team is open to all firefighters,and their families who have an extra dollar or two, who can help others in need.

teams.name: The Essential Compass
teams.loan_because: We know that will help individuals gain footage in their endeavor to move forward.
teams.description: Our Alumni group from the Essential Compass are committed to clarity, focus and empowerment.

teams.name: Philip Newby's Team
teams.loan_because: We Love Philip Newby and his Spirit will live on helping others.  Philip was a positive influence on us and we wish to share this energy with others.
teams.description: We are a group of friends with one uncommon friend, Philip Newby,  we would love to remember forever and share his beautiful spirit with you.

teams.name: Sushi
teams.loan_because: We remember the gift Sushi brought into our lives. Sushi reminds us that clean water, good food, and clean air, with lots of love, leads to a long beautiful life.
teams.description: Those who loved Sushi, my Rat Terrier, who faithfully served us as our friend and companion for almost 18 years, keeping confidentiality in all our classes.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.loan_because: It feels good to help people make a difference in their lives and the lives of their families.
teams.description: We are a family whose son/brother/uncle has been a Kiva lender for several years.  We are very proud of his accomplishments.  He is an inspiration to all of us.

teams.loan_because: BookCrossers love to share.

You can also join us for a chat on Bookcrossers Fighting Poverty www.facebook.com/groups/181300878717239

teams.description: We are a community for lenders by lenders. We welcome Kiva.org lenders to participate in our lender forums at KivaFriends.org

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Texas
teams.loan_because: Texas does it bigger!

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Jake's Bar Mitzvah Team
teams.loan_because: we are helping to tikkun olam (repair the world in Hebrew).
teams.description: My friends and family are supporting me to make the world a better place, and what better way to do that than to have funds that keep giving back so I can help through my whole lifetime.

teams.name: Kiva Jews
teams.loan_because: Tikkun Olam - making the world a better place.
teams.description: One of Judaism's most famous scholars, Maimonides, said that the highest form of charity is to help someone no longer need charity - and lending to Kiva does that.

teams.name: Kiva Austin Texas
teams.loan_because: We are big-hearted Texans and citizens of the world who enjoy sharing our prosperity and making a positive difference in the world.
teams.description:
a delightfully diverse group of Austinites. Be proud, Team Austin--our Kiva team is second only to NYC (with nearly 4X as many members!) for total lending for a city team. 
And a hearty WELCOME!! to all our new members.
